channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Vince Zampella, video game pioneer behind megahit Call of Duty, dies at 55
item.description: One of Vince Zampella's crowning achievements was the creation of the Call of Duty franchise, which has sold more than half a billion games worldwide.

item.title: Justice Department releases more Epstein files and some mention Trump
item.description: The Department of Justice has been publicly posting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation since Friday.

item.title: Zoox issues software recall over lane crossings
item.description: The company has issued a software update to its autonomous driving system to fix its lane-crossing behavior.

item.title: Hackers stole over $2.7B in crypto in 2025, data shows
item.description: This was another banner year for crypto hacks and heists — 2025 was the third year in a row that a new crypto theft record was set.

item.title: ServiceNow to acquire cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75B
item.description: The deal is expected to yield significant returns for Armis investors, including Sequoia, CapitalG, and Insight Partners.
